alert.note: Alert for Idaho (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 8:59PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT/11 PM PDT/ TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following county, Idaho. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT /1100 PM PDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 PM MDT /758 PM PDT/, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grangeville. - https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/?wfo=mso
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
